page.title: 08Other Industries
page.content: Scallops. These are shellfish which are caught by putting a frame with a net on it (called a 'dreg') into the water behind a boat. It is pulled along and it picks up the scallops from the bottom of the sea. Scallop fishing is mainly a part-time job. Mink. There is a mink-farm in Aith. It is a one person business. The man who runs it has about 300 mink which he rears to sell for their skins. The skins are sent to the mainland to be made into coats etc. Sheepskins. One person cures sheepskins to sell. About 1500 are made per year. The average price is about Â£18 but coloured ones are more expensive. Contracting. There are a number of contractors in the area. They do such work as house building and excavating.
